trifle noun
(UNIMPORTANT THING)
[ C ] formal a matter or object of little value or importance: I brought a few trifles back from India - pieces of jewellery and fabric mainly. a trifle
slightly: I'm a trifle confused about the arrangements for tonight. I have to say, his comment strikes me as a trifle disingenuous. I felt it was a trifle unfeeling of her. He was a trifle smug, I thought, on hearing the news. "I've tried to persuade him to change his mind," said Lauren, a trifle wearily. "I'm ready when you are," he said, a trifle impatiently.
